channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GLADIS: A General and Large Acronym Disambiguation Benchmark
item.description: Acronym Disambiguation (AD) is crucial for natural language understanding on various sources, including biomedical reports, scientific papers, and search engine queries.

item.title: Distributional constrained reinforcement learning for supply chain optimization
item.description: We introduce Distributional Constrained Policy Optimization (DCPO), a novel approach for reliable constraint satisfaction in RL.

item.title: Hierarchically Composing Level Generators for the Creation of Complex Structures
item.description: Procedural content generation (PCG) is a growing field, with numerous applications in the video game industry, and great potential to help create better games at a fraction of the cost of manual creation.

item.title: Perfect Is the Enemy of Test Oracle
item.description: This paper presents SEER, a learning-based approach that in the absence of test assertions or other types of oracle, can determine whether a unit test passes or fails on a given method under test (MUT).

item.title: Mitigating Data Scarcity for Large Language Models
item.description: In recent years, pretrained neural language models (PNLMs) have taken the field of natural language processing by storm, achieving new benchmarks and state-of-the-art performances.

item.title: Blockwise Self-Supervised Learning at Scale
item.description: Current state-of-the-art deep networks are all powered by backpropagation.

item.title: Leveraging Contaminated Datasets to Learn Clean-Data Distribution with Purified Generative Adversarial Networks
item.description: When training on such datasets, existing GANs will learn a mixture distribution of desired and contaminated instances, rather than the desired distribution of desired data only (target distribution).

item.title: CVTNet: A Cross-View Transformer Network for Place Recognition Using LiDAR Data
item.description: LiDAR-based place recognition (LPR) is one of the most crucial components of autonomous vehicles to identify previously visited places in GPS-denied environments.

item.title: MorDIFF: Recognition Vulnerability and Attack Detectability of Face Morphing Attacks Created by Diffusion Autoencoders
item.description: Creating morphing attacks is commonly either performed on the image-level or on the representation-level.

item.title: Ordered GNN: Ordering Message Passing to Deal with Heterophily and Over-smoothing
item.description: This is achieved by aligning the hierarchy of the rooted-tree of a central node with the ordered neurons in its node representation.

item.title: The Learnable Typewriter: A Generative Approach to Text Line Analysis
item.description: Second, we demonstrate the potential of our method for new applications, more specifically in the field of paleography, which studies the history and variations of handwriting, and for cipher analysis.

item.title: LIQUID: A Framework for List Question Answering Dataset Generation
item.description: Question answering (QA) models often rely on large-scale training datasets, which necessitates the development of a data generation framework to reduce the cost of manual annotations.

item.title: DCM: Deep energy method based on the principle of minimum complementary energy
item.description: Thus, we propose the deep energy method based on the principle of minimum complementary energy (DCM).

item.title: ShadowFormer: Global Context Helps Image Shadow Removal
item.description: It is still challenging for the deep shadow removal model to exploit the global contextual correlation between shadow and non-shadow regions.

item.title: Simple, Effective and General: A New Backbone for Cross-view Image Geo-localization
item.description: To address the above three challenges for cross-view image matching, we propose a new backbone network, named Simple Attention-based Image Geo-localization network (SAIG).

item.title: PyGlove: Efficiently Exchanging ML Ideas as Code
item.description: We also perform a case study of a large codebase where PyGlove led to an 80% reduction in the number of lines of code.

item.title: Using Explainability to Inform Statistical Downscaling Based on Deep Learning Beyond Standard Validation Approaches
item.description: Deep learning (DL) has emerged as a promising tool to downscale climate projections at regional-to-local scales from large-scale atmospheric fields following the perfect-prognosis (PP) approach.

item.title: Explicit Box Detection Unifies End-to-End Multi-Person Pose Estimation
item.description: This paper presents a novel end-to-end framework with Explicit box Detection for multi-person Pose estimation, called ED-Pose, where it unifies the contextual learning between human-level (global) and keypoint-level (local) information.

item.title: SegForestNet: Spatial-Partitioning-Based Aerial Image Segmentation
item.description: Aerial image analysis, specifically the semantic segmentation thereof, is the basis for applications such as automatically creating and updating maps, tracking city growth, or tracking deforestation.

item.title: TEXTure: Text-Guided Texturing of 3D Shapes
item.description: In this paper, we present TEXTure, a novel method for text-guided generation, editing, and transfer of textures for 3D shapes.

item.title: DilateFormer: Multi-Scale Dilated Transformer for Visual Recognition
item.description: In this work, we explore effective Vision Transformers to pursue a preferable trade-off between the computational complexity and size of the attended receptive field.

item.title: A Case Study for Compliance as Code with Graphs and Language Models: Public release of the Regulatory Knowledge Graph
item.description: The paper presents a study on using language models to automate the construction of executable Knowledge Graph (KG) for compliance.

item.title: KNOD: Domain Knowledge Distilled Tree Decoder for Automated Program Repair
item.description: KNOD has two major novelties, including (1) a novel three-stage tree decoder, which directly generates Abstract Syntax Trees of patched code according to the inherent tree structure, and (2) a novel domain-rule distillation, which leverages syntactic and semantic rules and teacher-student distributions to explicitly inject the domain knowledge into the decoding procedure during both the training and inference phases.

item.title: Committed Private Information Retrieval
item.description: A PIR scheme is $v$-verifiable if the client can verify the correctness of the retrieved $x_i$ even when $v \leq k$ servers collude and try to fool the client by sending manipulated data.

item.title: Tab2KG: Semantic Table Interpretation with Lightweight Semantic Profiles
item.description: We propose a one-shot learning approach that relies on these profiles to map a tabular dataset containing previously unseen instances to a domain ontology.

item.title: Policy Expansion for Bridging Offline-to-Online Reinforcement Learning
item.description: With this approach, the policy previously learned offline is fully retained during online learning, thus mitigating the potential issues such as destroying the useful behaviors of the offline policy in the initial stage of online learning while allowing the offline policy participate in the exploration naturally in an adaptive manner.

item.title: High-precision regressors for particle physics
item.description: Since the necessary number of data points per simulation is on the order of $10^9$ - $10^{12}$, machine learning regressors can be used in place of physics simulators to significantly reduce this computational burden.

item.title: Exposing the CSI: A Systematic Investigation of CSI-based Wi-Fi Sensing Capabilities and Limitations
item.description: We leverage our dataset to dissect the performance of a state-of-the-art sensing framework across different environments and individuals.

item.title: Laplacian Change Point Detection for Single and Multi-view Dynamic Graphs
item.description: how to capture temporal dependencies, and iii).

item.title: Visual Imitation Learning with Patch Rewards
item.description: Specifically, we present Adversarial Imitation Learning with Patch Rewards (PatchAIL), which employs a patch-based discriminator to measure the expertise of different local parts from given images and provide patch rewards.

item.title: On the Efficacy of Differentially Private Few-shot Image Classification
item.description: To understand under which conditions few-shot DP can be effective, we perform an exhaustive set of experiments that reveals how the accuracy and vulnerability to attack of few-shot DP image classification models are affected as the number of shots per class, privacy level, model architecture, dataset, and subset of learnable parameters in the model vary.

item.title: Bayesian Metric Learning for Uncertainty Quantification in Image Retrieval
item.description: We propose the first Bayesian encoder for metric learning.

item.title: A Simple Baseline for Direct 2D Multi-Person Head Pose Estimation with Full-range Angles
item.description: We present comprehensive comparisons with state-of-the-art single HPE methods on public benchmarks, as well as superior baseline results on our constructed MPHPE datasets.

item.title: STEPS: Joint Self-supervised Nighttime Image Enhancement and Depth Estimation
item.description: By fitting a bridge-shaped curve to the illumination map distribution, both regions are suppressed and two tasks are bridged naturally.

item.title: KST-Mixer: Kinematic Spatio-Temporal Data Mixer For Colon Shape Estimation
item.description: Kinematic data of a colonoscope and the colon, including positions and directions of their centerlines, are obtained using electromagnetic and depth sensors.

item.title: PASSerRank: Prediction of Allosteric Sites with Learning to Rank
item.description: Allostery plays a crucial role in regulating protein activity, making it a highly sought-after target in drug development.

item.title: GraphReg: Dynamical Point Cloud Registration with Geometry-aware Graph Signal Processing
item.description: Results demonstrate that our proposed method outperforms representative state-of-the-art approaches in terms of accuracy and is more suitable for registering large-scale point clouds.

item.title: Continual Learning with Scaled Gradient Projection
item.description: In neural networks, continual learning results in gradient interference among sequential tasks, leading to catastrophic forgetting of old tasks while learning new ones.

item.title: Provably Bounding Neural Network Preimages
item.description: Most work on the formal verification of neural networks has focused on bounding forward images of neural networks, i. e., the set of outputs of a neural network that correspond to a given set of inputs (for example, bounded perturbations of a nominal input).

item.title: Dual PatchNorm
item.description: We propose Dual PatchNorm: two Layer Normalization layers (LayerNorms), before and after the patch embedding layer in Vision Transformers.

item.title: Avalanche: A PyTorch Library for Deep Continual Learning
item.description: Continual learning is the problem of learning from a nonstationary stream of data, a fundamental issue for sustainable and efficient training of deep neural networks over time.

item.title: Benchmarking Algorithms for Submodular Optimization Problems Using IOHProfiler
item.description: Submodular functions play a key role in the area of optimization as they allow to model many real-world problems that face diminishing returns.

item.title: Paced-Curriculum Distillation with Prediction and Label Uncertainty for Image Segmentation
item.description: Purpose: In curriculum learning, the idea is to train on easier samples first and gradually increase the difficulty, while in self-paced learning, a pacing function defines the speed to adapt the training progress.

item.title: Over-parameterised Shallow Neural Networks with Asymmetrical Node Scaling: Global Convergence Guarantees and Feature Learning
item.description: We consider the optimisation of large and shallow neural networks via gradient flow, where the output of each hidden node is scaled by some positive parameter.

item.title: Dynamic Ensemble of Low-fidelity Experts: Mitigating NAS "Cold-Start"
item.description: In the first step, we train different sub-predictors on different types of available low-fidelity information to extract beneficial knowledge as low-fidelity experts.

item.title: Semantic Coherence Markers for the Early Diagnosis of the Alzheimer Disease
item.description: In this work we explore how language models can be employed to analyze language and discriminate between mentally impaired and healthy subjects through the perplexity metric.

item.title: Speech Enhancement for Virtual Meetings on Cellular Networks
item.description: We study speech enhancement using deep learning (DL) for virtual meetings on cellular devices, where transmitted speech has background noise and transmission loss that affects speech quality.

item.title: Neural Collapse Inspired Feature-Classifier Alignment for Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: In this paper, we deal with this misalignment dilemma in FSCIL inspired by the recently discovered phenomenon named neural collapse, which reveals that the last-layer features of the same class will collapse into a vertex, and the vertices of all classes are aligned with the classifier prototypes, which are formed as a simplex equiangular tight frame (ETF).

item.title: Hyperspectral Image Classification Using Deep Matrix Capsules
item.description: Hyperspectral image (HSI) classification is used in multiple domains like precision agriculture, mineral exploration, remote sensing, and others.

item.title: No One Left Behind: Real-World Federated Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: To tackle the above issues, we propose a novel Local-Global Anti-forgetting (LGA) model to address local and global catastrophic forgetting on old categories, which is a pioneering work to explore a global class-incremental model in the FL feld.
